Label: Achilles

Description: one of the nine lyric poets

Label: Zenodotus
Description: Hellenistic Homeric scholar, first librarian of the Library of Alexandria

Description: early Greek poet, attributed authorship of the Iliad and Odyssey

Label: Momus
Description: God of satire, mockery, poets etc

Label: Thetis
Description: sea goddess and mother of Achilles

Description: leader of the Greek forces at Troy

Description: Titan mother of Apollo and Artemis

Description: gods, descendents of Gaia and Uranus

Description: goddess of the hunt and childbirth

Description: god of the sea and earthquakes

Description: the archshepard in the Sminthean myth

Label: Heracles
Description: aka Hercules, son of Zeus, completed twelve labors

Description: son of Thestor, seer of the Greeks at Troy

Label: Licymnius

Description: god of war, often refered to as Enyalius (warlike)

Description: of Crete, poet and grammarian, late 3rd century BC

Description: stole fire from the gods, liver eaten daily by a bird

Description: first woman, unleashed all evils upon man

Description: river god on the Trojan side, called Xanthus by the gods

Description: queen of the gods, goddess of marriage

Description: ruler of a district of the Peleponnese called Aegialeus, founder of Aegialea

Description: son of Ixion, ancestor of the Centaurs

Description: son of Zeus and Aegina, father of Peleus

Label: Merops

Description: king of Troy, father of Hector and Paris

Description: titan of light, father of Helius

Description: titan of the sun, son of Hyperion

Description: son of Ares, king of the Lapiths

Label: Eris
Description: personification of strife, threw the golden apple

Description: son of Menoetius, comrade of Achilles

Description: king of the Paphlagonians, Trojan ally

Label: Eteonus
Description: son of Boethous, companion of Menelaus

Label: Eetion
Description: king of Thebe in the Troad, father of Andromache

Label: Hector
Description: Trojan prince, greatest of the warriors of Troy

Label: Hyas
Description: seems to be father of Merops?

Label: Briareus
Description: also called Aegaeon, one of the hundred-handed giants

Label: Ganymedes
Description: lover of Zeus and cup-bearer of the gods

Label: Hebe
Description: goddess of youth and cup-bearer of the gods

Label: Philitas

Description: father of Theseus, archaic king of Athens

Description: one of the seven against Thebes

Label: Iris

Description: Athenian Poet from the 5th century BC

Label: Dia
Description: wife of Acreus, mother of Thersites

Description: AKA Kointos Symrnaios, Greek epic poet who wrote the

Label: Thucydides
Description: The most awesome man who ever lived!

Description: Pythagorean scholar (possible two different people, it is uncertain)

Label: Stesichorus
Description: first great poet of the Greek West

Label: Cronius
Description: Pythagorean, attempted to explain Homer in a philosophical manner

Label: Alectryon
Description: Son of Itonus, father of Leitus

Label: Leitus
Description: Son of Alectryon, suitor of Helen

Label: Tiphys
Description: Son of Hagnias and helmsman of the Argonauts

Description: Son of Ornytus; King of Tanagra

Label: Asius
Description: Son of Cotys and Myion; King of the Lydians

Label: Semiramis
Description: One of the several Assyrian Queen

Label: Abas
Description: King of Argos; Grandfather of Adrastus

Label: Elephenor
Description: Son of Chalcodon; Suitor of Helen

Label: Megapenthes
Description: son of Menel?us by a slave

Label: Capeneus

Description: Talaos, son of Bias, king of Argos

Description: son of Talaus, brother of Adrastus, and father of Euryalus

Description: son of the Spartan King Oebalus and Bateia. His brothers (or half-brothers) were Tyndareus and Icarius.

Description: son of Poseidon and Tyro, king of Iolcus

Description: Nymph who gave her name to Macris, possibly Euboea

Description: son of Zeus and Thyia, first king of Magnesia, possibly a son of Aeolus

Label: Alector
Description: not sure? father in law of Megapenthes?

Description: a leader of the Magnesians from Thessaly, father of Prothoüs,

Label: Prothous
Description: son of Tenthr?don, a leader of the Magnesians

Description: son of Adm?tus and Alcestis, AKA Eumeleus
